intro: Humboltia angustifolia, commonly known as the narrowleaf humboldtia, is a flowering plant native to the western United States and parts of Mexico. It is a member of the Malvaceae family, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant typically grows in dry, rocky habitats and has narrow, lance-shaped leaves. Its flowers are usually pink or purple, and it produces small, capsule-like fruits. Humboltia angustifolia is noted for its adaptability to arid environments and its role in local ecosystems.
